column4: anyone use vim on ubuntu here? anyway to override default terminal colors when using VIm?
you can turn the syntax off
and turn the background dark or light
I like vim colorschemes and I hate that ubuntu has default colors.... want to switch that
how is that related to vim then?
secondly, what ubuntu colors are you refering to?
huh? go into gnome-terminal, go into profile preferences and then colors
I see no option there for not specifying any colors
what is this you define as "ubuntu colors"
I have no idea what your talking about..... in gnome-terminal, in profile preferences, there is a color tab for the terminal......
so you want it to be "colorless"?
I want it to let vim handle it
remember that gnome-terminal is one program and vim is another
